title: Bob Newland
text:
Robert Vaughn Newland (October 27, 1948 – June 30, 2021) was an American professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player who was a <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a> in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL). He was drafted by the <a href="New%20Orleans%20Saints">New Orleans Saints</a> in the seventh round of the <a href="1971%20NFL%20Draft">1971 NFL Draft</a>. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for the <a href="Oregon%20Ducks%20football">Oregon Ducks</a>.
Early years.
Newland attended <a href="North%20Eugene%20High%20School">North Eugene High School</a> in <a href="Eugene%2C%20Oregon">Eugene, Oregon</a>. He went to college at the <a href="University%20of%20Oregon">University of Oregon</a>, where he was the <a href="most%20valuable%20player">most valuable player</a> for the <a href="Oregon%20Ducks%20football">Ducks</a> in <a href="1970%20Oregon%20Ducks%20football%20team">1970</a>.
Death.
Newland died on June 30, 2021, aged 72.
